That's a great plan! Bodyweight exercises are an excellent way to improve your strength, flexibility, and overall fitness. Remember to focus on proper form and technique, as you mentioned, and don't sacrifice form for the sake of completing the exercise.

Here are some additional tips to help you get the most out of your workout:

**Squats:**

* Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes facing forward or slightly outward.
* Keep your back straight, chest up, and engage your core muscles.
* Lower your body down into a squat, keeping your weight in your heels, not your toes.
* Push through your heels to return to standing.

**Push-ups:**

* Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and feet hip-width apart.
* Engage your core muscles and keep your body straight from head to heels.
* Lower your body down until your chest almost touches the ground, then push back up to the starting position.
* Avoid letting your hips sag or your back arch.

**Lunges:**

* Stand with your feet together, take a large step forward with one foot, and lower your body down into a lunge.
* Keep your front knee bent at a 90-degree angle and your back knee almost touching the ground.
* Push through your front heel to return to standing.
* Alternate legs with each rep.

**Planks:**

* Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and feet hip-width apart.
* Engage your core muscles and keep your body straight from head to heels.
* Hold the plank position for 30-60 seconds, breathing naturally.

**Mountain Climbers:**

* Start in a plank position, then bring one knee up towards your chest and quickly switch to the other knee.
* Mimic the motion of running, keeping your core muscles engaged and your body straight.
* Continue for 30-60 seconds, rest, and repeat.

Remember to listen to your body and rest when needed. It's also essential to warm up before starting your workout and cool down afterwards to prevent injury.

You got this! Stick to your plan, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or need any adjustments.
